meanings.sent1: The earthquake shogged the ground fiercely.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally shogged the table while walking past it.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected sneeze shogged the cat off the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The loud thunder shogged the peaceful night awake.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster ride shogged my whole body with excitement.

meanings.sent1: The wind shogged the leaves off the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: He shogged his chair closer to the fire for warmth.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy shogged the ball across the room.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gust of wind shogged the kite into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The boat shogged as it hit the rough waves of the ocean.

meanings.definition: To cause to move or shift suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise shogged the birds from their nests.
meanings.sent2: She shogged the puzzle pieces into place with a quick motion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel shogged the acorns down from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected announcement shogged the audience into silence.
meanings.sent5: The sudden brake shogged the passengers forward on the bus.
